subject: Parenting
title: Screens and Sleep Sabotage
description: One-minute skill: Screens and Sleep Sabotage.

hook.text: A teen scrolls her phone in bed at midnight. The blue light tells her brain it's noon.

buildup.text: Screens emit blue-spectrum light that suppresses melatonin production.

discovery.text: Even 30 minutes of screen use before bed delays sleep onset by about 20 minutes.

twist.text: It's not just the light â€” the content keeps the brain in an alert, reward-seeking state.

climax.text: Teens who charge phones outside the bedroom fall asleep faster and sleep longer.

punchline.text: The phone is a light that tells the brain to stay awake.

quiz.question: How does screen use before bed affect teens?
options: Blue light suppresses melatonin and delays sleep
